article.headline: American U. 64, Navy 59
article.story: WASHINGTON -- Garrison Carr scored 20 points and hit four free throws in the last 28 seconds to help American hold off Navy 64-59, clinching the Eagles' second straight Patriot League regular season title and home-court advantage throughout the tournament. American (20-7, 12-1) defeated Navy 68-67 on Jan. 28 to begin its current nine-game winning streak. The Eagles have also won 15 of their last 16 and 14 straight Patriot League home games. American led by as many as nine points in the first half, but the Midshipmen (18-10, 7-6) pulled ahead 49-48 on a Kaleo Kina jumper with 7:23 left. The lead changed hands seven more times before Carr hit two free throws for a 60-59 lead with 28 seconds left. Carr added two foul shots with 19 seconds remaining, then Frank Borden's two free throws sealed the win. Kina and Adam Teague led Navy with 19 points apiece.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
